intro: Hypochaeris albicans, commonly known as white sowthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of smooth, waxy leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is native to Europe, North Africa, and western Asia, but it has been naturalized in many other regions. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Hypochaeris albicans is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
